intro: Psiadia integerrima, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant has hairy, gray-green leaves that help reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy seeds dispersed by the wind. Psiadia integerrima is adapted to thrive in poor soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
